only found one in exception log
We need codes, because others are using these, and no issue reported. We have test cases, but passed. So, we need you to provide detail, which could tell us how this error happens.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16357470/57674823-dede0980-7652-11e9-8ecb-47b37d837e30.png)

这个代码片段是否有帮助？从异常中就找到这个地方。或者是否可以我们准备一下环境，您remote调试
Hi, I think you changed our source codes, we don't have that.
I didn't do anything. The code is in skywakling-agent.jar from agent directoty, apache-skywalking-apm-6.1.0.tar.gz
But we don't use this. We use the agent every day.
From the codes you post, there is only a `class.forname` attempted. Will switch to no-op. Also, this is `FINE` level log.

I think this is a wrong description in document, when I submit span storage implementation. If analysis is true, there is no need to switch to zipkin elasticsearch, keep as elasticsearch.
I think this is a wrong description in document, when I submit span storage implementation. If analysis is true, there is no need to change storage.

I could understand this description easily. nice

On Sun, May 12, 2019, 8:20 AM 吴晟 Wu Sheng <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Today's analysis process, in the easy scenario, really could transfer
> spans to SkyWalking trace. We used to demo it. Such as
>
>    - https://twitter.com/adrianfcole/status/1007625470886567936
>
> I am welcome to have a deeper discussion on improving this feature. But
> please notice, as an APM, we have less flexible in span tags and the spans
> of each trace. Meaning, if you want to have the SkyWalking topology,
> metrics, and alarm, you need to have logically the same raw data.
>
> Right now, the major issues of Zipkin receiver, not production ready are
>
>    1. Cluster mode is not supported. Because Zipkin sends trace through
>    span by span. But the whole analysis needs the whole trace to build
>    SkyWalking segments. One segment means all spans of one trace in one
>    process(or thread). But in ZipkinSkyWalkingTransfer#doTransfer, it
>    uses CacheFactory.INSTANCE, which use CaffeineSpanCache to cache the
>    span with timeout mechanism. The CaffeineSpanCache use memory cache.
>    In production and cluster mode, this cache should be a distributed cache
>    env, and each trace timeout should be controlled by one OAP instance. Such
>    as always let the OAP instance, who received the root span, to process the
>    timeout and analysis the whole trace.
>    2. CaffeineSpanCache#onRemoval is the entrance based on timeout to
>    assume the whole trace has been received, which could begin to analysis in
>    Zipkin2SkyWalkingTransfer. The transfer process in SegmentBuilder#build
>    including the complex steps, which I am not sure ready and suitable for
>    everyone.
>
> I think you have read https://github.com/SkyAPM/zipkin-skywalking ,
> actually, that document is wrote by me and @adriancole
> <https://github.com/adriancole> back to the back we were building this
> feature as step one.
>
> So, you need to fix the above two issues.
>
> Also, when we came into SkyWalking 6.x, we have a better solution than
> analysis of the whole trace.
>
> The following suggestion should have better performance in trace analysis,
> but you need to understand SkyWalking more.
> When needAnalysis=false today, the trace/span have been saved in storage
> already, and query has been supported. So, the things we left are topology
> and metrics, these two actually are the same thing. *Build scopes*. You
> could read MultiScopesSpanListener#parseEntry,
> MultiScopesSpanListener#parseExit and MultiScopesSpanListener#build.
> Especially the #build method. If you have read SkyWalking OAL document,
> you should know, SkyWalking analysis core receives the scopes.
> In Zipkin receiver, we could only process span having remoteEndpoint,
> matching the client span <-> server span, instead of building the whole
> trace. Build the service, service instance, endpoint and relationship
> scopes. This could significantly reduce the memory cost of distributed
> cache in issue(1). But you still need that the cache.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/2653>, or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAAPVV76POPBWAEBP4OTQ73PU5PEHANCNFSM4HMJHS6A>
> .
>
Please submit the integration test cases. Do you know where to submit!

@wu-sheng 我这边中文描述一下这个问题：
当一个类继承一个泛型的虚基类，然后他的子类又复写了这个类的方法，同时调用的是虚基类中的方发时。skywalking的InstMethodsInter.class 的intercept方法，找到是zuper会是自己本身，导致执行zuper.call()出现死循环，最终导致栈溢出。经过测试这种java结构编译没有问题，运行也是可以的，但是skywalking加上会出现死循环，希望能够尽快修复，**### 这是一个严重的bug，导致正常业务出现栈溢出!!**
Try making a roadmap , community may do some contribution :)

@wu-sheng 
我这里有写一个demo，复现了skywalking在6.0版本的bug(apache-skywalking-apm-incubating-6.0.0-GA-src)。[https://github.com/zmjzmjzmj8/skywalking-bug](https://github.com/zmjzmjzmj8/skywalking-bug)

> Try making a roadmap , community may do some contribution :)

Contributions are always welcome, but roadmap means we are going to do. For this, I am not sure.

@candyleer Could you try this? I am still working on J9vm and other PR review.

I am not sure why super causes this.

Why a class treat itself as a super class. Maybe consider whether this is a bytebuddy bug.
We don't do anything about finding super class.
@zmjzmjzmj8 if you have time, try to update our bytebuddy version in agent dependency, to see whether it fixed this?
@wu-sheng 我尝试过同样的继承结构，但是虚基类并不是泛型的，是不会有问题的。初步推断是和泛型有关，你的意思是bytebuddy有对泛型父类有bug？skywalking中有对泛型做相关处理吗?

Please don't keep replying in Chinese. We need to keep the context open to the world. 

From I known(which may be wrong), we don't process Java Generics class especially. And Java Generics should be as same as the other class, just typecast and compile check.

I am not sure which trigger this issue, but worth a try based on simple byte-buddy codes and do an upgrade.

@ronghuaxiang I need a more detailed environment to reproduce this problem.
Can you point me out where I am doing wrong?
SkyWalking agent:master(with optional-plugins)
spring-boot-starter-web:2.1.2.RELEASE
spring-data-redis:2.1.2.RELEASE
lettuce-core:5.1.0.RELEASE(i use lettuce)
case:https://github.com/zhaoyuguang/sky-case/blob/master/src/main/java/test/zhaoyuguang/cases/component/SearchInfoTask.java
No crash occurred, schedule is normal.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10150229/57748452-91be6e00-770c-11e9-82c2-0d94e80c2027.png)

I met similar skywalking error log when building skywalking 6.1.0 + elasticsearch 7.0.1.
After I downgraded elasticsearch version to 6.7.2, the error log no longer occurs.
So I guess the problem may be somewhat related to calling certain api that no longer supported by elasticsearch 7.

BTW, the detailed error log with es 7 is as below. I hope it may be helpful in troubleshooting:

One client span is a parent of another client span? I definitely was expecting this happens. SkyWalking segments expect, exit span(client) always matches entry span(server), and for an RPC, only one exit and one entry.
This is OK, because we use Optimistic Lock. So it fails sometimes.

1. SkyWalking don't use proxy mechanism, so not at the same time. Agent changes codes when classes loaded in Clasa Loader.
2. SkyWalking doesn't care about final method or attribute, because we change class file in memory.

We can't use Spring AntPathMatcher, because we can't deliver plugin depend on Spring. You could improve the path matcher in SkyWalking.
